definition: Kaesong or Gaeseong city in southwest North Korea, close to the border with South Korea and a special economic zone for South Korean companies

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
Kaesong or Gaeseong city in southwest North Korea, close to the border with South Korea and a special economic zone for South Korean companies

sentences.english: First, do you have any comment on the Kaesong meeting between the DPRK and the ROK?
sentences.chinese: 第一，你对朝韩开城会晤有何评论？

sentences.english: Peace talks began, first at Kaesong, then at Panmunjom.
sentences.chinese: 和谈开始，首先在开城，然后在板门店。

sentences.english: Kaesong is the last inter-Korean cooperation project still extant.
sentences.chinese: 可是开城的最后的南北合作项目还仍然存在着。

sentences.english: Park Young-man is the executive director of the Corporation of Kaesong Industrial Council.
sentences.chinese: 朴英曼是开城工业局公司的执行董事。

sentences.english: I have two questions. First, do you have any comment on the Kaesong meeting between the DPRK and the ROK?
sentences.chinese: 我有两个问题。第一，你对朝韩开城会晤有何评论？

definition: to dispatch an army/to send troops
to follow up a victory/to pursue retreating enemy
to withdraw troops from the front/to return in triumph
Hanseong, former name of Seoul (capital of South Korea), replaced in 2005 with 首爾|首尔[Shou3 er3]
to guard/to hold a fortified position/entrenched
